intro: Rinorea botryoides, commonly known as the clustered rinorea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a velvety texture. Rinorea botryoides is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in humid environments.
